website_summaries.verdict: Great image quality and sharp screen resolution of 3440 x 1440. Controls may be too complex for some.
pros: Very good screen resolution for a wide screen monitor
Good gaming option with fast response times
Thin and lightweight for such a large screen of 34"
Curved screen and wide viewing angle offer immersive experience
cons: Some questions over the quality of this display screen over the long term

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing flaws
customer_reviews.text: I would like to give a positive review as we've had good experiences with the brand, but sadly, both the original product and the replacement exhibited manufacturing flaws. One had a vertical purple line, the other a horizontal white line, with random pixels always white. We tried the highest quality HDMI cables and had the same result with two separate computers. Interestingly, Windows 10 does not automatically recognize the monitor, even though it does recognize most others. Overall, a disappointing experience and we ultimately returned both the original purchase and its replacement, not wanting to waste our time with a third attempt.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Nice high resolution screen. I have three of these in one display for a total of 5760x1080, and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super sleek monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Love this monitor! I connected this to my MacBook Pro using a Hedgedock. It works great as soon as I plugged it in the screen is very vibrant. There is very little frame and the screen goes almost all the way to the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Phil & Courtney Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Not at all what I expected for MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.text: ASUS customer service: 5 stars Clear directions on connecting a Macbook Pro: 1 star (hint: extra purchases required). I used an HDMI to USB-C connector. Ease of set-up once you have the right connectors: 5 stars (plug and play is great). Screen resolution: 1 star. OMG. I used to think the whole "retina" display was marketing hype. I was SO wrong. And the 1080p (=1920 x 1080) is really big and super fuzzy compared to my laptop. I definitely did not appreciate how 1920x1080 doesn't give you much real estate on the screen. You get what you pay for. My recommendation is to spend the $ for a higher resolution - you'll make up the difference in eye strain.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Lots of real estate!
customer_reviews.text: POSITIVES: - Great screen - Very clear video - Very clear harmon/kardon sound - Lots of room for two side-by-side windows, one for web development, one for browser - Use my Mac for video conferencing. - Never have to switch windows. Keep them open all of the time. NEGATIVES: - Screen does not move up and down, so I have to put it on a 6" stand to sit behind my Mac screen and not block. - Controls not easy to manipulate or figure out. - Audio control is so hard to get to, I don't bother adjusting it. OVERALL: - AMAZING MONITOR! Well worth the $$$. - Significantly improves my productivity as a web/mobile developer.
customer_reviews.author: Neil F. Sambol

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, great footprint for a 27" flat
customer_reviews.text: Really. Even with the images provided in the item description, I expected the monitor to take up more space than it does. Lightweight and well balanced, to boot! Pic included in case you're prone to the occasional misjudging of how much space a thing will occupy. Buddha, coaster, mouse, sharpie and shot glass for proportion/size comparison. Amazon included these features/criteria for individual consideration on the rating portion: For gaming: my rating is 5/5 Picture quality: my rating is 5/5 Brightness: my rating is 5/5 The default brightness was way too much for me. Fortunately, adjusting the settings is a breeze. The touch-sensors for the menu, power, volume, etc are a bit finicky... but I got used to it. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Peter Carrier

customer_reviews.title: 2 years running daily
customer_reviews.text: Two year review. This monitor is still performing flawlessly. I use external speakers because I'm a music nut, and need a better range than these can provide. I use this monitor in an automotive repair shop and I still get compliments from my customers saying how good it looks. The picture isn't as crisp as some 1080 monitors, but I needed the non-glare screen, as we have windows behind us. This helps tremendously, but in turn loses a little picture quality. I use it for side by side applications, Excel on one side, browser on the other side. Works great and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nierman

customer_reviews.title: LED vs LCD
customer_reviews.text: I knew going into it that this is an LCD and not an LED, and I now regret it. The difference is very clear. The sheer size of the monitor makes up for it but it also falls short in the speakers. Yes I know, what could I have possibly expected from built-in speakers? But the promises of B&O quality got me and I regret that as well. The monitor is very decent and I can't complain but I wish I would have gotten LED. These are older units so anyone purchasing this just know that you may be disappointed with the quality although the value is definitely there. Hope this helps! Other than that, the monitor externally looks dope!
customer_reviews.author: Control Room 2020

customer_reviews.title: After piloting this monitor against three other models, my ...
customer_reviews.text: After piloting this monitor against three other models, my office decided on this monitor for all of our designers. My office does a mix of graphic design, instructional design, multimedia, and other graphics heavy work. The colors are rich and very well defined. The refresh rate ensures that all images are clean. The matte finish keeps glare to a minimum from any light source. The only draw back to these monitors are the function buttons. The buttons will trigger if you breathe on them wrong. Otherwise, after installing a pair of these at more than 40 work stations, my office has had nothing but rave reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfsblood2012

customer_reviews.title: 2017 Gamers review
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is a dream come true it is incredibly clear for gaming I use a PC, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch. I could not recommend this monitor more for the price you really are getting what you pay for great quality. I got mine on time no dead pixel or anything like that so it was perfect. Also I noticed that people said there monitor was ghosting but mine does not do that what so ever I'm glad I picked this up it is a very high quality screen don't listen to the fake reviews that say it sucks this monitor rocks so I hope this changes anybody's decision when purchasing a monitor.
customer_reviews.author: OT

customer_reviews.title: outdated cables included
customer_reviews.text: Who in 2019 ships a monitor with an HDMI cable that has another end that plugs into no modern devices whatsoever? Why did you not include an HDMI to HDMI cable? I now have to work an additional two days without a monitor because you did not a usable HDMI cable. My gaming laptop at home, and my work computer, cannot possibly use the cables you included. If you buy this monitor and require HDMI, I recommend purchasing an HDMI to HDMI at the same time so you do not encounter the same issue I am facing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for semi competitive gaming, and content creation.
customer_reviews.text: Great panel for the price range. The 100hz, and 4ms response time leave very little screen tearing, and ghosting. Beautiful looking panel, and the wireless charging built into the stand is an amazing plus. Do make sure you have the GPU to push this panel before you purchase it. *Edit* I have now had this monitor for a few months, and it is still great. I have had time to go through the options on it too. It is loaded with gaming extras. For example FPS counter, builtin cross hairs. Also has options for screen inside screen. Witch would work nice for watching say your stream while streaming If you don't have more than one screen on your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Leeskiie

customer_reviews.title: Glare problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this awhile back and was pleased for the most part with the display quality. After a few months the speakers went out and Asus paid for return shipping to them then replaced it with a brand new monitor. One thing I noted is that even though it's supposed to be a matte finish to defeat glare it had a huge problem with sunlight. I sit in a corner office with windows all around and even with white curtains, the sunlight that made it through made it near impossible to see anything. I'm not a fan of the stand either. Not being able to rotate or even mount this monitor leaves you yearning for a monitor with more options.
customer_reviews.author: Nizel A.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for photography editing
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of these bad boys for editing photography. Once calibrated with a spyder calibrator, they look very nice. Unless you are color-correcting hollywood blockbusters, there's no need to buy anything more expensive than this monitor. A lot of people complain about the touch-sensitive buttons to access the monitor menu, but I rarely have to use them and it's really not that big of a deal. People complain about them because the touch-sensitive design is not something that we are used to, but I think it's pretty innovative design, but I don't mind either way. The quality of the screen is perfect for the photography work that I do.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor With One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent monitor - beautiful color and wonderful resolution. My only complaint is that it seems to have a long "warm up" time. If it is cold, and my desktop is in a room where the temperature is in the low 60's, it "flickers" (mostly off) until it warms up. My solution has been to set the monitor's screen saver to ON and prevent the PC from going to sleep or hibernating. I suspect there is a faulty solder joint somewhere in the monitor's circuitry that is causing this. Once it reaches operating temperature, it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L.

customer_reviews.title: 1 year usage: No Image Flaws/Weak Built In Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a year ago - bottomline no major image flaws weak audio coming from the built in speakers which prob. is a tradeoff for the price Monitor usage conditions for the past year - daily work monitor - it's always on - not used for gaming - decent image for average HD youtube videos, webcasts , video conference - cannot stand crispy images so I normally kept switching between night mode and reading mode Hope this info helps anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jaziel Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor but poor delivery
customer_reviews.text: I love these monitor they are great to look at and they do not bother my eyes. We now have 4 of this in my home but for this last purchase I was disappointed at how the item arrived. The box was open and broken at the top and it barely stayed close. Luckily this monitor was intact and all accessories where still in the box. Either the warehouse or the delivery driver need to pay more attention to detail and handle item with care. Another option would be for the shipper to place this item in a box to ensure damage free package arrives.
customer_reviews.author: HLSR

customer_reviews.title: XPS 15 9550 and PS4 connected to it.  Awesome display!
customer_reviews.text: I received the MX259H and can honestly say that this is one of the best looking monitors I've seen to date. The picture quality is breathtaking. I have my XPS 15 9550 connected to it as an extended display in one of the HDMI ports. My PS4 is connected on the 2nd HDMI port. Wow, does the PS4 look amazing on it! One thing to note: I bought an HDMI cable because I couldn't find any information on what was included in the box. Save your money; it does come with an HDMI cable. For the price, this is one of the best monitors you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: SRX

customer_reviews.title: The most beautiful monitor I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son's Windows based iMac replacement. Its plugged into a Intel NUC and works incredibly well. My son wanted an elegant but functional look and this seemed like a good fit. It was pricey, but my son is worth it. We had no problems out of the box, everything worked great. Its been 4 months and everything is still perfect. The wireless charger built into the stand is the icing on the cake...perfect monitor!! The only problem I have is now I want one too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Audio Problem
customer_reviews.text: Love the picture, unfortunately audio cuts out for about 1 second intermittently. I have tried different HDMI cables tried both HDMI ports, installed updated drivers...nothing working. My previous ASUS monitor audio worked fine, but since getting new monitor upgrade, audio has been a major nausance. Wish I'd spent more and got different brand. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: ATHiker

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Return
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a heavily scratched base; obviously used and repacked for resale. I might have kept it in spite of this as the picture quality was good (reason for two stars instead of one). However, the instructions which came with it only covered assembly and did not describe the monitor controls in any way. These controls are non-intuitive and seem to work intermittently or have a very long delay following an input. The switches for the controls provide no feedback as to whether an input has registered. In addition, the speaker sound quality was exceptionally poor. Sent it back the day of arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Bruschak

customer_reviews.title: Nice Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Amazon Warehouse return. It works well except I can't get the on board speakers to work. However, I have an external speaker set up and don't need the on board speakers. The monitor has a really nice picture. I wasn't sure about the 27" size, but I like that also. If you are thinking about this Monitor I would buy it again. As long as the speakers work in a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Killian6pk

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The design of this monitor really is gorgeous. Slim bezels with the silver bottom looks awesome. The screen is nice and clear, and it gets really bright too. Playing games on it is very pleasant. The colors are vivid, and the 5ms response times makes it virtually impossible to see or feel any input lag. The speakers on this monitor are pretty decent. Of course, they're not bose quality or anything, but speakers on a monitor this price is incredible. The buttons on the bottom are touch sensitive, which takes some getting used to. Other than that, I have no complaints. I'm totally happy with this monitor!
customer_reviews.author: J W

customer_reviews.title: reasonably priced compared to other similarly spec monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily to increase the screen real estate in order to comfortably have applications displayed side-by-side. So far I'm very happy with the setup. One thing I did have to do is to create a custom resolution for my Lenovo X1 Carbon in order to use the Asus full resolution of 3840 x 1440. My desktop running a gaming graphics card had no issues detecting the highest resolution of the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: El Kabong

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing monitor with fantastic picture quality - a truly amazing experience. The speakers are also quite good despite being built in speakers. The only reason I took off a star is due to the fact that my first unit had a dead pixel in the lower left hand side of the monitor. Thanks to Amazon hassle free returns I was able to get a replacement unit here in about two days, and my second unit has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Mikesuper26

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a triple monitor setup with a stand. Every time Nvidia did an update the configuration would reset (even though i saved it). I grew tired of messing with it so went for one large monitor. I love this thing, great picture for gaming, uses display port and HDMI hook ups. The speakers are a little weak but I mostly use a headset anyways. Plus I am loyal to ASUS products as I never had an issue with any of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Best Design IPS Monitor For The Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this monitor is a great buy. An extremely slim bezel, stable stand, beautiful construction, IPS, excellent color reproduction, decent response times, and large matte near edge-to-edge display makes this a solid panel. PROS: - Stable stand, beautiful silver/black design. - Excellent color reproduction. - The picture quality is great. Colors appear as they should. - Fluid OSD with neatly tucked away touch controls. - HDMI Audio passthrough with headphone port if your graphics card allows it - Good for plugging in headphones when playing games, especially if using a console. - Powerful sound. CONS: - No DisplayPort!!! - No Gamma adjustments. Overall: I'd recommend this for people who a monitor with good color quality for design proposes.
customer_reviews.author: Haithm EL-Watany

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely pleased and would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I just unpacked this monitor and hooked it up to my Xbox One. Played some streaming video. This thing is really outstanding. The picture is crystal clear, but the matte coating makes it so that I don't get glare. Perhaps most surprising? The Bang & Olufsen speakers built into this monitor are surprisingly loud and full sounding, a rarity for built in speakers! Totally impressed with shipping time, with quality of the picture and the edgeless design makes this monitor feel bigger than 25". What a gorgeous piece of hardware for under $200. Absolutely pleased and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bruhn

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an ultra wide monitor, and picked this one because of previous good experience with Asus monitors. This one is just what I wanted. It is big, wide, QHD (3840x1600), and gorgeous. Very fast setup, no problems, and no dead or stuck pixels. This is primarily for work, and it is good enough for gaming for me. I recommend for anyone looking for more screen space for serious work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT to be used as a Television replacement due to no remote control...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good monitor BUT you cannot expect it to perform as your old television because unlike your television, this unit does NOT have a remote control so whenever you want to change the volume, you'll have to walk up to the set and manually press the volume up and down buttons. You can use this as a tv replacement only if you don't care about its lack of remote controllability.
customer_reviews.author: CDToaster

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for price. Keep on mind even though there isn't a thick bezel there is still an area proud the edge without pixels, so it's kinda like a bezel. The menu is kinda annoying if you feel the need to change color saturation etc. Still a good monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday and would highly recommend! The display is great and audio is satisfactory (I usually use headphones). It’s the perfect size for splitting the screen in half to work on two things at once without having to strain your eyes so much. Sleek, frameless design is very beautiful. The screen is also matte which makes it easy to keep clean!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great Performer
customer_reviews.text: A very nice monitor with great color, good input selection with a nice set of complementary cables, and decent audio. Increasing maximum brightness would be a plus, and the overly-sensitive touch control panel takes getting used to. Starcraft II, Defense Grid: The Awakening, and Elite Dangerous gameplay are a joy on the generous screen, especially when using the dedicated headphones jack. Very good performance, design and build quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes up less space than my old 23" monitor and looks great both on and off.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is a great addition to my PC. It feels like I got a new computer. The display quality is excellent and it came with every cable under the sun in the box, including HDMI, DVI to HDMI, VGA, and PC stereo cables. While the sound leaves much to be desired for music and movies it's fine for podcasts and YouTube videos. For what it is worth, I got the used Amazon Warehouse version, like new.
customer_reviews.author: J. Paul Fontana

customer_reviews.title: 27" of viewing goodness
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if this would work well with the resolution desired for my MacBook Pro Retina 15", but it works very well. I wouldn't say it looks as crisp or as clear as the laptop display, but as my job requires 6-8 hours of computer time, it works well. The one thing I noticed right away is that the monitor is very bright. As a preference, I had to dim the display quite a bit, but for those that want something bright and vibrant, this is a good choice. I didn't, and still don't, have any problems with ports, pixels, adjustments, etc. Overall it's a great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: cocamoxb

customer_reviews.title: Superior Quality Display.  Make Sure Your Video Card Has HDMI Port.
customer_reviews.text: The DVI to HDMI connection resulted in a 1" darkened border around the screen. In other words, it was not filling up the display and settings were maxed out. Since I was unable to locate a solution for this issue I purchased a $57 ASUS Graphics Card with an HDMI connection on it. Resolved and I am loving this monitor. I couldn't be happier with the quality of this thing. If it dies in less than 5 years I will change my rating. I don't go for companies that purposely make products to go obsolete quickly or break quickly, nor do I go for any products or services created by Eugenicists.
customer_reviews.author: FlyBot791

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the monitor I'm looking for.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor arrived with no dead pixel and minimum back light bleed. I have to get a monitor raiser because it's not height adjustable. Normally this lack of height adjustment would warrant less star but I knew this before I bought it. Image quality is comparable with my old Dell U3011 with IPS panel. Gaming performance is really good. Coming from 60 Hz monitor really gives noticeable positive difference. Qi charger works flawlessly. menu system and control is one of the best I've ever used. Internal speakers is also pretty good. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pilot

customer_reviews.title: New monitor with huge greasy palm print?
customer_reviews.text: Makes me a little suspect about these. I've ordered about 8 of these monitors in the past year. They are very good. But this one was different. I first noticed the security tape on the box flap what not present. Then when I took the wrap off the monitor I noticed this palm print on the face of the monitor. Then I plugged it in and the colors were all jacked up. Not factory default settings, thats for sure. Makes you wonder. Curious what Amazon will have to say about this...
customer_reviews.author: favsob

customer_reviews.title: Poor Contrast Ratio
customer_reviews.text: This monitor should not carry the Eye Care branding. I own 4 other Asus eye care monitors and this one does not stack up! The blacks are a dark grey at best and my eyes fatigue noticeably faster than when using the other monitors. Extremely poor execution from Asus and I've been disappointed with this monitor when text is involved (which is 90+% of the time for me). There are other aspects of the monitor I like, but with such a poor contrast ratio I can't score this any higher.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Todd

customer_reviews.title: Died just after two years
customer_reviews.text: Bought February 4, 2016. Today (2-15-2018) it died. Barely over two years and it dies. Now, if I have to answer, "is the monitor worth $100 a year?" Sure it is. At the price and feature set it is still worth it to only last two years. BUT that doesn't change that money doesn't grow on trees and I don't want to have to purchase a new monitor right now to replace it. I really liked the monitor when it worked. I bought two of them and the other is working just fine. I'm sad, hence two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: awesome monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, I have 3 monitors decided to replace all 3 of them with this one, great choice. it's less clutter, the wireless Qi charger is a bonus. Wish asus would have made the power button simpler to turn on and off. Instead you have to go into the menu to look for the off button, come on, one button on and one button off. nothing can be simpler than that. Other than that it's great, lot of screen.
customer_reviews.author: J. WU

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works the way it's suppose to. Meaning the description is accurate. The image quality is excellent and makes a great impressive beautiful addition to my desk. I have two computers that I move on and off of the monitor and it's an easy process. Wireless charging is a nice feature. Only wish is the speaker volume was louder. Needs external speaker.
customer_reviews.author: BC59

customer_reviews.title: Perfect monitor
customer_reviews.text: Got this as my gaming monitor and it's perfect. The picture is amazing and the frame-less design makes it look cool even when not in use. I would buy this again should I accidentally break it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Henchen

customer_reviews.title: Looks good! Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to fully evaluate the monitor but it arrived in excellent condition and was easy to unpack, assemble and connect to a desktop pc.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Super bright, but horrible for dark gaming and clarity
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely bright! But, the clarity is washed out. Gaming is horrible in low-light areas (dungeons, night, etc.), and requires brightness turned all the way up. Menu is cumbersome. Touch sensors are nice, but really sensitive (accidentally open with slightest hand brush). Kinda worth the money, but not for advertised use - maybe a good office monitor.
customer_reviews.author: mick

customer_reviews.title: great price, very vivid and perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about 2 years now and they work wonderful. No glare, perfect for long term use and provide a lot of screen for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Daocsm

customer_reviews.title: excellent monitor
customer_reviews.text: Not a gamer, it's excellent for work however - the brightness, angle and clarity significantly reduce glare and eye strain being in front of this for 10+ hrs/day. Menu system/access takes a bit of 'getting used to' and it's fairly intuitive once you do, but using a single joystick control is slightly cumbersome -especially for items such as volume up/down/mute - items that would better be addressable directly than via a menu system
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor for design professionals
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and use this monitor exclusively for work purposes and I love it. I've been using it since November 2018 and have experienced absolutely no problems with it. My only complaint is that you can't use a monitor mount for it because of the charging pad. However, the charging pad is a nice bonus so for me it evens out.
customer_reviews.author: P Sievert

customer_reviews.title: Broke so easily
customer_reviews.text: So there is a panel that comes off in the back in order to access the display ports. It is a really terrible design as far as how difficult it is to plug something in. I was using the top of the monitor as leverage with one hand while plugging in an HDMI cord. It seemed to go in nicely but when my display loaded, the screen was badly cracked beyond use. I understand it was my fault. But I've owned SO MANY monitors over the years and never had one break this easily. It is a shame because the monitor was awesome for the couple weeks that it lasted. I'll probably go with LG next time.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, don't buy extra cables!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor and the picture is rich and bright. All the cables you'd need are in the box: DVI to HDMI, power, Sound, and VGA. Don't buy any cables unless you need a regular HDMI. Hooked this up to my old Mac mini in about 5 mins. Talks to Mac well and picture is very nice. Mac goes into sleep mode fine. My only complaint is that this monitor is a tad too low and there's no way to adjust the height. At least not that I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Terrier Fan22

customer_reviews.title: Does no one make monitors to last anymore?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this monitor Dec 2, 2017. Screen started acting up a little over 2 years after I purchased it. Screen whites out and adds horizontal lines in some odd cycle. I verified it's not a cable or graphics card issue (I have a 2 monitor setup of the exact same monitor - made comparisons easy)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE 2019 A year later
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year now still love this monitor considering to buy another so I can have a dual monitor set up. No issues no concerns at all Don't usually write a review right after. I like to wait at least a month after having the product to write. What stood out to me the most was the picture quality. There's no glare very good quality clear image. Compared to a 19-inch crappy monitor the Asus 25 is a huge update for me. Posted pictures on what comes with it. I'll update after a month.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever
customer_reviews.text: Pros It's extremely bright, doesn't have connectivity issues, has built in audio, it's thin (VERY thin), and looks incredibly good. It's bezels are amazingly small, and the colors are rich but not oversaturated. Cons: While the speaker quality is good, don't hinge your purchase on them. LCD is more vulnerable than other displays, so be careful taking out out of the box. What I use it for: Word processing, online work (dual screen) Gaming (M279 only)
customer_reviews.author: impressed

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: After seeing positive reviews for this monitor, I decided to purchase. I needed something decent for doing design work and thought this would do the trick. However, after using it for a year, I've realized that the quality just doesn't cut it. I get headaches if I look at the screen too long and it's really hard to read text. I'd recommend spending a bit more to get something of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor so much that I bought two. Great color, great response time for gaming. The back of the monitor is rather cheap plastic, but the base ring is metal and after the power is turned on you don't even see the monitor anymore anyway. Easily adjustable, and doesn't have a particularly large footprint. Two of them fit easily on my gaming desk. I didn't realize it had speakers until it arrived, and I have played around with the sound a tiny bit without being over-enthused about the quality, but mostly this thing is playing Witcher III or 7 Days to Die and it performs perfectly. At this price it's too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: C. Michael Shay

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Display
customer_reviews.text: Great display. Love the low blue-light option (available on the 25", not sure about the others). Great picture quality, and just an aesthetically pleasing piece of hardware in general. I'm using this with a Macbook Pro as well as a Windows 10 desktop. Works flawlessly with both. I do wish the picture went closer to the edge of the screen but this is a common issue with so-called "frameless" displays and the online photos do give an accurate representation of what it looks like when turned on, so it's hard to complain. Decent speakers by monitor standards, but that's not saying a whole lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chitown Lurker

customer_reviews.title: Monitors are beautiful. I don't know all the stats like some ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for a dual monitor set-up. Monitors are beautiful. I don't know all the stats like some reviewers but they look fantastic in the dark as well as diffused daylight. I've had no problems whatsoever. Everything looks great. One thing to note is that the buttons to adjust the screen are touch sensitive, they don't have to be pushed down. This can be really confusing if you accidentally brush your hands across them and then can't figure out why something is on the screen and how to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great features for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Aside this being a LCD monitor and not LED, this monitor filled my needs perfectly. It came with all the cables needed to connect it as needed. The sound is excellent and having two HDMI inputs is a real plus. Definitely a worthwhile buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tali18

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best 34"
customer_reviews.text: Best screen I have so far. I want to wait until at least a year to review though because durability is very important to this price range of products. But definitely good to have! Wireless charging, speakers, and all that many HDMI ports made it even better product.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Leung

customer_reviews.title: 4,5 Stars =)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second monitor, first one i bought about 4 years ago and had no issues... I use them for editing pictures and drawing in Autocad. Line work doesn't appears blurry or unsharp, maybe a little bit broken while drawing inclined lines. In the samples you can see that lines from 5 to15 degree and 75 to 85 degree appears a bit broken. Overall if you aren't a control freak and you don't mind a small distortion of lines, think it is a nice choice for that price. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Easy hook up, cables included, good picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor for over a month now. It was a piece of cake to hook up, all the needed cables were included. The size is perfect, allows for side by side document viewing with ease - plenty of room! Great for working via the cloud without the hassle of hooking my laptop in; because this screen is sized for that. HDMI inputs are a great convenience as we have an old Roku hooked to it; which then switches the use to one of a TV. I am very pleased with the price an the picture quality as well. I would recommend & buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: The screen is sleek and amazing. good picture and extremely easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This review is being made only hours after unpacking and setting up. The screen is sleek and amazing. good picture and extremely easy to set up. It comes with all the cords you could need wether you are VGA to VGA HDMI to HDMI or VGA to HDMI. packaged very nicely. I used this screen for a second computer monitor at work. I would definitely buy again for home computer gaming if and when that time comes, but thus far do not know how it reacts for gaming in terms of frames and such. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Keefe

customer_reviews.title: I really like these monitors
customer_reviews.text: I really like these monitors, but after owning them for about a year, I'm starting to notice random violent flickering. I even figured one was broke and went to pack it up, but the next day I turned it on and it went back to normal. They've been really good monitors for the year, but I'm expecting them to die soon because of the flickering.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Heckman

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I use a MacBook Pro Retina and this monitor translates color VERY WELL. In the monitor box was a very nice HDMI cable...wasn't expecting that. This is a great extension when I'm working With Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and Premiere Pro. Great, true picture with many adjustments at your fingertips. Geez, they should hire me in the Brown Nose Marketing dept. This is a rock solid investment. Crisp video & sound by the audio virtuosos Bang & Olufsen.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Loverly!
customer_reviews.text: I got this monitor as a second screen for my computer and it was a good deal. It looks GREAT! I have my playstation hooked up to it as well and the sound works really well. My complaint would be that the volume is a little awkward to handle and I haven't been able to set up the sound to work with the computer (might just be me, but my other monitor has great speakers so I honestly haven't tried very hard). I will definitely be getting another one when the price drops again!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: The picture is great, the sound is really good
customer_reviews.text: This not frameless, it merely does not have bezel on the top, left, or right of screen panel. The picture does not go edge to edge. There is a 1/2 inch gap of blackness on all but the bottom edge. The picture is great, the sound is really good, but one must mess with menu selections to adjust the volume. It should be much easier to turn the volume up and down. It's a good monitor, but I'm returning it because I thought I was paying for a frameless monitor and I hoped the volume could be quickly adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a standard PS4
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my standard PS4 and I am also using this as one of my PC monitors. Works great for both uses. Wanted a monitor that was IPS that was not too big. Bought this USED - Like New and it was in great condition. Colors are great for what its worth. Would recommend if you plan on buying for console or PC if you are not getting a 144Hz monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Luan

customer_reviews.title: I can not say enough about this monitor.  The colors and the resolution jump out from the display panel.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is really nice. The panel renders color and detail exquisitely. That is a word I rarely use. My last ASUS monitor was a 25.5" and it lasted over 8 years. It still works but has developed a few little problems. I got my money's worth. The physical design of this monitor is very streamlined and has no useless weight. The speakers sound pretty good for internal type. I use an external system for sound. The grayscale is very detailed. I am real happy right now. Thanks to ASUS an to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Charles McGehee

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor :) volume controls hidden in the menu :/
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is superior and it's matte which I absolutely love. I'm taking one star off for a volume control, I'm using a Macbook PRo with this monitor when you are sending video and Audi over HDMI there is no Audio control via mac F11, F12 volume buttons. No remote control for this monitor so if you want to adjust volume, not only you have to do it manually but also you have to go through some seriously complicated menu options and adjust it. For such a great monitor not to provide volume control buttons it's a crime. ASUS please step up your game and fix this then you will get 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Marcin.G

customer_reviews.title: I love this monitor soooo much
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor soooo much. It's just a beautiful monster, and I never really though I'd use the Qi charger much, but it's amazing how nice it is to be playing something like World of Warcraft, and then doing runs on a mobile game while it charges nearby. I've had a few friends see this monitor and just go, "I waaaaant'. I know buddy. I know.
customer_reviews.author: CottonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's been great! I work from home and it's improved my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a month. It's been great! I work from home and it's improved my work life greatly. Large, super clear display with great brightness and contrast. I've even used it to watch a game, while I watched another game on a bigger tv (like my own sports bar!). The controls are a little wonky, since they are raised dots that are touch-sensitive and easy to accidentally bump, but nowhere near a major deal, to me. Audio is O.K. Typical audio for any LED/LCD monitor or TV. I see it as a bonus, since monitors rarely have audio. I've only used HDMI on it.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great monitors. No Built In VESA.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is gorgeous. I don't know about color correction or anything like that. As far as the stats of the monitor goes I never really look to verify it does what it says it does. But let's be real... do any of us ever do that? lol. This monitor performs as expected and it looks gorgeous while doing it. I bought three of them, bought the VESA adapters, and put them on a VESA stand. They all perform and look amazing. I use them for web development, office work, and video games. My only request is that in the next iteration of them that they build the VESA mounts into the monitor instead of requiring a third-party adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Zeal

customer_reviews.title: Good for Xbox
customer_reviews.text: I personally think it is perfect for Xbox. I use it with my One S & play Rocket League or Cod/PubG/Apex and you notice a huge difference in response time. When I go back to my 50” LG 4K it feels slow and laggy even with the lag delay settings set to make it run as smooth as possible. TV’s aren’t meant for gaming, wish I would have got a monitor 10 years ago when I was 16 gaming all the time haha this is my second time buying this same monitor only because I knocked it over and it broke. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Brisley

customer_reviews.title: Incredible design triumph with a few gotchas...
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again. Almost non-existent bezel is a marvel, i would definitely use these for a multi-monitor setup. Has a strong, bright, crisp image. The only cons for this monitor are sometimes the color seems off, the response time is not the fastest, and it doesnt always autoscan stretched 100% edge-to-edge at all resolutions. The poorly designed teeny controls to adjust screen dont work well my my larger hands. All in all, if can be acquired via amazon warehouse at deep discount, a good buy. Would buy again. If i were to do a multi-monitor setup, i would probably use these, unless the exact same bezel design were available with a faster response time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Displays
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these for a new PC setup. It's been about a month so far and I l've them, no issues at all. Bright crisp displays. My only complaint is that the bottom bezel is thicker than the rest of the display so when using three it creates a 2-3 cm space between the screens. Overall I'm very happy with these screens.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R

customer_reviews.title: Big, beautiful display with nice matte finish.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this monitor. Design is sleek and modern. The display is large and clear. And the matt finish is awesome if you have a sunny room (I use this in my home office). I am using with a mini mac and agree with a previous review that it is clearer with the RGB and mini DVI attachment rather than HDMI. I would have thought otherwise but it is definitely better with the RGB. Speakers are fine but if you really want to amp it up, get a Soundbot (®-SB571-Hands-Free-Speakerphone-Rechargeable/dp/B00MITLPX2/ref=sr_1_3?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1426954505&sr=1-3&keywords=soundbot) speaker for 35 bucks - works wirelessly or just attach to the headphone jack. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: gol4guy

customer_reviews.title: Dislike it
customer_reviews.text: This one looks good but way toooo heavy. The support pod at the back of the monitor is too tight and feels like can’t be turned. My finger was cut due to this. Not sure why it was designed like that. Changed to a LG 27’ Which I like so much.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful image and stylish monitor
customer_reviews.text: After doing a ton of research, I found a great deal on the Asus 27" monitor. The only regret I have is that I didn't purchase a second one during the Thanksgiving sales. I found a second one refurbished and now use two of these great monitors. They look really nice and provide a sharp image that pops. Keep in mind that there is about a quarter of an inch black edge around the image even though some websites advertise this monitor as an edge to edge screen. The sound quality is okay but if you plan on listening to music I can definitely recommend getting external speakers. I only use these monitors for business purposes and photo editing.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: IPS ftw
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor. Vibrant. Love the low profile edges. It's isn't mountable out of the box, not VESA compatible. I found an adapter on Amazon for $30 and mounted it, so factor that in to your budget if you want to mount. I game for a few hours a day on this monitor and haven't had any problems, no dead pixels. I've owned and used for about 3 months. If you're looking for IPS, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Edwards

customer_reviews.title: The image quality is incredibly good, just like the design
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is incredibly good, just like the design, however, it looks overall dim and opaque, even at max brightness.The audio is better than in my BenQ, but still sounds odd, "encapsulated" or even as if it was mono.The touch option buttons get annoying as i try to adjust the monitor from time to time, i've never been a fan of this kind of buttons where you don't have feedback that you pressed it other than its effect on screen.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great looking budget monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I am a graphic designer and I purchased this to use with my laptop. I liked the clean, minimalistic look and the large screen was much easier for working in illustrator compared to the 13 inch screen of my mac. As long as I keep my laptop plugged in I can keep it closed and just use the bigger screen. The display is crisp and clear and graphics seem to display true, though as another reviewer stated, I would not go any larger than the 25 inch and expect to retain the clarity. For the price you can't beat this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Logic

customer_reviews.title: Everything it says
customer_reviews.text: This monitor/TV is everything I needed it for. Photoshop, use as a television, internet browsing. It is HUGE and the picture quality is excellent. Everything it says it is and it does - it is and it does. The size and thin bezel make it a true 27" monitor. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: GreenMtns

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED!!! still decent tho
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is very good. Looks beautiful. However, the seller had this listed as a 'touchscreen' which is why I ordered it, to go with my new rig build and Windows 10 install. WARNING: THIS IS NOT NOT NOT a touchscreen. Shady vendor, good monitor. I have decided to keep it as it will be used as an array setup once I get my touchscreen, which will be my primary. Although, you can get a faster refresh rate and a bigger screen for about $40 less from another vendor. Shop around, pay attention to reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Vinkun007

customer_reviews.title: It is also an awesome game monitor
customer_reviews.text: my husband says he loves it, he is a software engineer who work at home. He has two windows up to help to look up code and code. It is also an awesome game monitor. The price is decent and the sound system works well for a monitor. I would have bought one too if i didn't like my two set up
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Macbook Pro pairing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor to pair with my 2015 Macbook Pro laptop. Initially I plugged in using an HDMI cable. It worked immediately! I did not have to change any settings or pair anything...it just worked. I have since switched to a Mini DisplayPort to HDMI cable just for aesthetics and it works perfectly fine too. The monitor has really nice color and the speakers provide nice sound. I am really happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Allan Hack

customer_reviews.title: No HDMI to HDMI cable, really??
customer_reviews.text: This monitor came with 2 cables: 1. A straight up VGA cable and 2. A DVI to HDMI cable, but NO straight up HDMI cable. I can't use this with my laptop until I go purchase an HDMI cable. What year do they think this is is anyway??
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor for those of us who struggle to read smaller text on laptop screens. Nice design and very crisp. The only issues I have are that the border where the pixels end is a decent bit inside of the actual outer border of the screen, and the max dimness is still more dim than some other monitors can get.
customer_reviews.author: Joey D

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Monitors!
customer_reviews.text: I had been shopping for a pair of nice looking Widescreen (1920X1200) monitors to compliment a new computer build. At first, I was going to pay up to a $1000.00 for one higher resolution monitor, but after seeing these; I changed my mind. Pros: -Well Built (not flimsy like Dell monitors) -Sleek, modern design -Great picture quality -IPS rocks! (Easy to show multiple people computer screen from most angles) Con: -Can't mount on a monitor arm to get off of desktop If you have the "real estate" on your desk, I suggest getting this monitor. They are a real "eye catcher" when you walk in the room and a great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Gaither

customer_reviews.title: Great looking monitor in every way!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor! I was actually more than pleased with it! Crystal clear, no dead pixels and I love the overall look. I'm a photographer so I put it in sRGB mode and then calibrated it and it looks great! The sound, while nice sounding overall, is a bit muddy for my personal tastes but honestly the audio portion was only a bonus for me personally. You're mileage may vary!
customer_reviews.author: EvvPhotog

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product but...
customer_reviews.text: What a great monitor!! It has everything! Including great built-in speakers, good for your eyes when gaming! The price is same as other monitor with same features except they don’t have speakers! BUT BUT the front grill with the logo ASUS on it came right off! And can’t be put back cuz it just comes back off again. I’m call support and see what they say! Then I’ll update my post.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Great for Such a Cheap Monitor
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says, this is surprisingly great for such a cheap monitor. The visual quality is stunning after tweaking the OSD menu, and the viewing angles are great for such a (relatively) cheap monitor. It has a 5ms response time (one of the downsides of an IPS panel), but that isn't going to be noticeable for but a very few, and even then the difference is negligible. Overall, I highly recommend this monitor for a cheap, but great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Image quality poor and settings buttons not intuitive and hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this product because of the features listed and the price. However, after connecting it to my computer the image even at 1920x1080p looked grainy. After 4 days suddenly the monitor brightness went crazy and the image on the display had a double vision/ghosting effect. Shipped it back and purchased the Asus MX279 27" monitor. Super happy with the Asus monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Good color and resolution
customer_reviews.text: I'm no monitor expert. Good resolution. The colors are good. It was easy to set up. I needed 2 monitors so this is now my primary. With the wide screen, it's easy to see 2 windows side-by-side on the one monitor. I have absolutely no complaints. I like the narrow border; not a lot of useless border taking up space.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Asus Designo MX279HS Monitor - 27
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has a signal that it has been repaired, the vega function does not work for you and you can listen very low to the sound, I wish I could change it to another model.
customer_reviews.author: jftp77

customer_reviews.title: Man this thing is sweet. Love the buttons on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Man this thing is sweet. Love the buttons on the bottom, since they just require you to make contact with them. Kinda makes it tricky when trying to manage the menu really fast, but otherwise good. The black gets weird to me, when playing really dark games. I was playing Unturned again and it spawned me in a super dark area with no lights, the bottom area of the screen was turned slightly away from me and it just looks odd. Otherwise great monitor. After a while my PC recognized the size limits and lets me view the desktop in 4k resolutions.
customer_reviews.author: Cregg L.

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent monitor. Especially valuable to use multiple pages -- ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent monitor. Especially valuable to use multiple pages -- side by side when in taking online exams or spreadsheets. The quality of the DPI is crystal clear. The sound decent. Plus it comes with a three year warranty from the manufacturer -- you cannot go wrong with this ASUS. Easy installation. Excellent quality and weighted stand. All in all a great product. The bevel edges are slick and the overall design contemporary. It's tops in terms of product support, too.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. TED

customer_reviews.title: After 2 years still wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Marvelous monitor. You have to learn how to use the buttons. Therese no remote control, but once you figure it out you will be delighted. Took me a few minutes to get the protocol. Sound and color just right and in two years the screen has never faltered or lost resolution.
customer_reviews.author: David A Fairbanks

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is absolutely amazing. Bright
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is absolutely amazing. Bright, clear, crisp - everything I could ask in a display. I'd prefer it to be height adjustable, or at least have VESA support so I could put it on a different mount, but alas. Still, the height works well for me (6'3") when I'm at my desk. The only reason I give this 4 instead of 5 because that little silver bar across the bottom of the monitor (you see it in the picture) - the right side of it keeps peeling away from the screen. There doesn't appear to be anything I can do about it.
customer_reviews.author: Bajah

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide screen easy on the eyes
customer_reviews.text: This screen is wide. The picture quality is good and I haven't had much eye strain. Easy to adjust brightness. It only seems to pan up or down not left or right without the whole base moving.
customer_reviews.author: N. Haydel

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years and died
customer_reviews.text: Good monitor but died early: Lasted only 2 years. Purchased on: October 13, 2016 Died On: October 13, 2018
customer_reviews.author: simmons
